sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 10 cm and the length of its two parallel sides are 15 cm and 20 cm respectively. Calculate the area of this trapezoid in square centimeters?
message_2:
To calculate the area of a trapezoid, you can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) * (sum of parallel sides) * height

In this case, the parallel sides are 15 cm and 20 cm, and the height is 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area = (1/2) * (15 + 20) * 10
Area = (1/2) * (35) * 10
Area = 17.5 * 10
Area = 175 square centimeters

So, the area of this trapezoid is 175 square centimeters.
